CatDescriptText: Willie Aikens, delivery man, 2171 Wylie Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 23, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that there will be a steel strike?  Do you think steelworkers are entitled to the raise which they requested or do you think wages should be frozen, according to the argument of the steel industry management?" answer reads: "I do believe that there is going to be a strike.  I think that the union is asking for too big of a raise than what they should have but I think that they should have some raise."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Willie Aikens wearing moustache, dark hat, and striped shirt, standing on Smithfield Street in front of C.A. Michel and C.C. Mellor Co., Downtown
